article.headline: Long Beach State 66, Loyola Marymount 65
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Aaron Nixon's 35-foot, 3-point shot at the buzzer lifted Long Beach State to a 66-65 victory over Loyola Marymount on Friday. Nixon's game-winner came after Loyola Marymount had taken a 65-63 lead on Derick Grubb's basket with 2.8 seconds remaining in the game. After the first inbound pass was knocked out, Nixon sent the ball in at half court to Kejuan Johnson who immediately gave it back. The long-range shot propelled the 49ers to their fifth straight win. Nixon, Long Beach State's leading scorer with 16.7 points per game, made only one of 12 shots before the winning basket. Loyola Marymount (8-6) lost their first home game of the season. They had rallied back from an 11-point deficit despite losing their second-leading scorer, Matthew Knight, to a knee injury midway through the second half. Knight is expected to miss a month with the strain. In a game Tuesday against Boise State, the team lost its leading scorer, Brandon Worthy, to a season-ending knee injury. Sterling Byrd led Long Beach State (7-4) with 16 points. Adoyah Miller led Loyola Marymount with 20.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
